707555f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 28th St. E.
707555f-a.text:
First Avenue, west side, south from E. 29th (right) te 2 th
(left) Streets, shewing a row of tenerents and a factory structure.
To the south of the latter aprears a corner of Cornell Medical
College. The photoorapher is vievino southwestward across the
clearance for the new Psychopathic unit of Bellevue Hospital on the
eastside of this thorouughfare between 295h and 30th Streets.
April 30, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

711875f-a.title: Manhattan: 28th Street (East) - 1st Avenue
711875f-a.text:
345-331 East 28th Street, adjoining and west of the N. W. corner
of First Avenue. On the right is the Carmelite Roman Catholic
Church.
april 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
